name: Sticky floors, Glass ceilings and Leaky pipelines: Understanding Trends in Women's Employment in India
description:
Why are so few of India’s women employed? What does it mean to be counted as employed? What kinds of employment do women predominantly engage in, particularly in our cities? Come join Rosa Abraham as she explores how labour force surveys measure employment and discuss the implications for the measurement of women’s work.

Until recently, the proportion of employed women has steadily declined in rural areas and stagnated in urban areas. There have been several explanations for the low and declining rates of participation of women in the workforce. One perspective argues that women's domestic work, care burden and gender-based norms keep women out of the paid workforce. A more recent argument points towards the lack of job creation as a fundamental reason for fewer women in the workforce. Drawing on primary surveys and official secondary data, Rosa will examine each of these explanations to better understand the reasons behind the persistently low and falling rates of women’s employment in India.

name: Studio Visit to Pagal Canvas
description: Science Gallery Bengaluru is taking you on a visit to Pagal Canvas Studio to give you an exclusive glimpse into their creative process, from showcasing their publications to demonstrating diverse printing techniques. Come join us and immerse yourself in a hands-on Mono-printing workshop using unique botanical prints inspired by nature, experimenting with textures and patterns to craft a one-of-a-kind masterpiece. Explore the vibrant world of printmaking at Pagal Canvas Studio!
